Dear Harry
I want to reply to your several letters of recent date as follows:
1. I do not believe that you should have Keith Engar
pursue the Hinckly project. I can arrange a meeting
for Dick Hull and Bill Harley.
2. We are working on the translator proposal and by now
you should have received the comments which we pre¬
pared.
3. I agree with the letter which you wrote to Bob Schenk-
kan regarding the Speech Association of America
statement to the F. C. C. However, 1 believe the en¬
tire topic should be discussed at the next Board meeting.
4. We hope to have an answer for you on the tax exemption
on transportation within the next two weeka.
The correspondence which you sent me from Schenkkan and Engar is
enclosed for your files.
Sincerely
Leonard H. Marks
